titles.title: Expressing the sense of the House of Representatives that a national World War I memorial should be established.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.

bill.summary: 7/8/2011--Introduced. Expresses the sense of the House of Representatives that: (1) the District of Columbia War Memorial should remain a memorial dedicated solely to the residents of the District of Columbia who served in World War I, and (2) a congressionally authorized study or commission should determine a proper location for a national memorial dedicated to all Americans who served in World War I.
